channel.title: Virus Help Pl0x?
channel.description: got a virus named "antispyware soft" thats pretending to be my antivirus. Its blocking ALL of my utilities such as internet, command window, antivirus, control pannel, winrar mspaint ect. when i restart it just opens up and does the same thing again. As there is alot of computer wizards over here, i couldnt think of a better place to come. Any suggestions?

item.title: Virus Help Pl0x?

item.description:
@4markie wrote:

I had something alot like this

I used malwarebytes.org and it was like magic…

Read full topic

item.title: Virus Help Pl0x?
item.dc:creator: @Javafire Javafire
item.description:
@Javafire wrote:

Pigrear:

Its been gone since the night of posting this topic. Im not a retard. I know how to get rid of a virus, i just wanted to see if there was a better way then booting into safe mode, because my comp goes wonky after i do that, but i guess not.

okay, lol i actually went the stupid way and rebuilt my o.s. but then i got linux and my life was perfect.

Read full topic

item.title: Virus Help Pl0x?
item.dc:creator: @Javafire Javafire
item.description:
@Javafire wrote:

[quote=“Pigrear, post:1, topic:338547”]got a virus named “antispyware soft” thats pretending to be my antivirus. Its blocking ALL of my utilities such as internet, command window, antivirus, control pannel, winrar mspaint ect. when i restart it just opens up and does the same thing again. As there is alot of computer wizards over here, i couldnt think of a better place to come. Any suggestions?[/quote] It’s a Trojan. I’ve had it before. Backup as much data as possible and rebuild your operating system. End of discussion. I recommend learning how to use Linux and getting Ubuntu, Fedora, or OpenSuse. Those will basically be immune to these types of Trojans.

EDIT: Here is a removal article. http://www.2-spyware.com/remove-antispyware-soft.html

Read full topic

item.title: Virus Help Pl0x?
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

reyx7:

No. Youtube is protected. google is protected. Everything has an address. My documents has an address. My pictures has an address. This page has an address, or a web address, if you will. Depends on if MITB has the site decently protected or not is whether or not you may or may not get a virus, depending on firewall, anti virus, ect.

No, you have no idea how the internet works. It has nothing to do with if the website is protected, it is ONLY if your computer is protected.

Read full topic

not really. Do you know how a virus spreads? Obviously not.
[/quote]

If that was true, everyone who basically has internet would have a virus. So if Pigrear went to YouTube, we’d all be fucked?[/quote]
No. Youtube is protected. google is protected. Everything has an address. My documents has an address. My pictures has an address. This page has an address, or a web address, if you will. Depends on if MITB has the site decently protected or not is whether or not you may or may not get a virus, depending on firewall, anti virus, ect.

item.title: Virus Help Pl0x?
item.dc:creator: @Pigrear Pigrear
item.description:
@Pigrear wrote:

[quote=“justinxg27, post:14, topic:338547”]Delete the process. To find the process, open task manager, right click your “Anti Virus” and click “go to process”, check what process it is, While here, “End” the process. Since it’s not running on your computer now, you can delete it without windows telling you that it’s being used; Just use “search” to find the name of the process, they are Exe’s.

OR, buy anti Virus, hobo.[/quote]
Did you read my post, and the posts following? Clearly not. I couldn’t open or run anything. I have AVG, it wouldnt let me run it. >.>

Read full topic

item.title: Virus Help Pl0x?
item.dc:creator: @justinxg27 justinxg27
item.description:
@justinxg27 wrote:

Delete the process. To find the process, open task manager, right click your “Anti Virus” and click “go to process”, check what process it is, While here, “End” the process. Since it’s not running on your computer now, you can delete it without windows telling you that it’s being used; Just use “search” to find the name of the process, they are Exe’s.

OR, buy anti Virus, hobo.

Read full topic
